questions.question: How would you interpret the husband's behavior in para. 1 when the narrator first meets him?

choices.answer: Happy and carefree
Grouchy and whiney
Concerned about not catching anything
Immature and silly

questions.question: What happened to the narrator's parents?

choices.answer: They died.
They moved South, leaving the place to the two sisters.
They bought a bigger house close by.
They ate too much ham.

questions.question: In paragraph 2, the narrator describes “the happy year” of her life. Why is she so happy?

choices.answer: She's glad to be out of the house with her sister.
She is happy as a stay at home mom.
She loves listening to the music of the Lodge Meetings.
He husband is kind, a good singer, and a leader.

questions.question: What does "I'll never know a joy like that again" suggest about what will happen in the story?

choices.answer: They will live happily ever after.
Something bad will happen to the husband.
The husband will have an affair.
The wife leaves her husband.

questions.question: When does something "come over" the narrator's husband?

choices.answer: When the sun rises
In the dark of the moon
During lunchtime
After her returns from work

questions.question: How did the husband get this curse?

choices.answer: A witch put a spell on him.
He ate magic beans.
It runs in his family on his father's side.
He contracted it from the blood of an infected monkey.

questions.question: Describe the narrator's style of speaking: "He come in and she got scared-looking stiff."

choices.answer: She sounds somewhat uneducated and makes grammar mistakes.
She sounds like a college professor with a huge vocabulary.
She sounds like a well-educated person with no mistakes.

questions.question: What is the awful memory the narrator wishes she could forget?

choices.answer: Her husband hits her youngest child.
Her youngest child ruined her husband's favorite shirt.
Her youngest child is terrified of her husband.
Her youngest child ran away and could not be found.

questions.question: What quote best shows the time of day are they all sleeping?

choices.answer: "It was hot and close inside."
"I saw him standing in the tall grass by the entrance."
"I heard a little stir in the passage."
"It was light...hard sunlight coming in from the door."

questions.question: What happens to her husband's feet?

choices.answer: They stretched out and lost all their hair.
They stretched out and grew hair.
They curled into hairy paws.
They shrunk in and developed claws.

questions.question: What does "He was white all over, then, like a worm's skin" describe?

choices.answer: The husband losing his fur.
The husband's new human skin.
The husband's transformation.
All of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a description of the husband after transformation:

choices.answer: He stood on two hind legs.
He  had a flat, wide mouth.
He had sharp, grinning fangs.
His ears are gone.

questions.question: What epithet does the narrator use to describe a human being?

choices.answer: "The hateful one."
"The two-legged one."
"The wormy one."
"The dangerous one."

questions.question: The narrator changes the pronoun she uses when describing her husband at the end of the story:

choices.answer: She used to say "him" and now she says "it" and "thing."
She used to say "I" and how she says "you".
She used to say "it" and now she says "him."
She used to say "I" and now she says "it."

questions.question: What causes the narrator to attack her husband?

choices.answer: "It picked up a heavy fallen tree-branch."
"The mother anger come into me then."
"It turned on [her sister] and raised up the branch to hit."
"It had no gun, like the ones from the man places do."

questions.question: Who comes to the aid of the narrator?

choices.answer: Her husband, father, and mother.
Her sister and her human neighbors.
Her friends from college.
Her sister and the rest of the wolf pack.

questions.question: What was the singing at Lodge Meeting nights?

choices.answer: Her husband singing with a church group.
Her husband singing with an adult choir.
The wolf pack howling at the moon.
A cult chanting in the moonlight.
He ran away with another woman and never returned.
He was attacked by the wolf pack.
He was hit by a car.
He was curse with a terrible blood disease.
